snippet: Ronell Wilson, who was sentenced to be executed for the 2003 murder of two undercover police officers on Staten Island, was found to be mentally competent for the death penalty.
abstract: Ronell Wilson, sentenced to be executed for the 2003 murder of undercover New York City Detectives James V Nemorin and Rodney J Andrews, is found not to be mentally retarded, and therefore eligible for the death penalty.
lead_paragraph: Ronell Wilson, who was sentenced to be executed for the 2003 murder of two undercover police officers on Staten Island, was found to be mentally competent for the death penalty.

headline.seo: Ronell Wilson, Killer of 2 Officers, Is Eligible for Death Penalty, Judge Says
headline.main: 2 Detectives’ Killer Is Eligible for Death Penalty, Judge Rules
headline.print_headline: 2 Detectives’ Killer Is Eligible for Death Penalty, Judge Rules
